results.title: The Research director
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, ONF | NFB and Ronald Weyman
results.brief_description: A description of the work of a research director of a United Steel Workers Union in Canada. The painstaking research and analyses of economic information, and the arrangement of arguments that lie beneath the negotiations of labour unions for better wages and working conditions are shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Morten Parker, ONF | NFB and Ronald Weyman

results.title: The Rescuers (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman, Walt Disney Productions, John Lounsbery and Art Stevens
results.brief_description: Courageous rescues are the speciality of secret agent mice, Bernard and Bianca. An innocent orphan named Penny is kidnapped by Madame Medusa, a wickedly wacky villainess. Madame Medusa needs Penny to recover a priceless jewel. Bernard and Bianca set out to save Penny from Madame Medusa’s evil clutches. Voices are provided by Bob Newhart, Eva Gabor and Geraldine Page. Animated.

results.title: The Rescue
results.creator_credit: Harry Govan, BBC Film Unit and Gordon Mackay
results.brief_description: How two young climbers get into difficulties and are saved by the joint efforts of a Royal Air Force Mountain Rescue Team and other experienced climbers. Contrasts correct ways of mountain climbing with careless methods. Set in the mountains of Argyll and Inverness.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Govan, BBC Film Unit and Gordon Mackay

results.title: The Republic will never forget = Gong he guo bu hui wang ji
results.creator_credit: Guangxi Film Studio and Zhai Junjie
results.brief_description:
Huajiang Steel Factory is a state-owned enterprise which faced some serious challenges with production declines and labor force drain in the late 1970s. The general manager, Tian Geng learned the opinions of the staff and went to Beijing with the company’s Chief Financial Officer, Zhong Tianwen to report to the State Council. Tian Geng promised to turn in an annual profit of 50 million yuan, if the State Council would approve his reform plans based on the contractual agreement. Tian Geng’s proposal was approved, but his decision to appoint Lan Yumeng as the deputy manager was opposed by the Party Secretary, because Lan had an affair with an engineer, Feng Lu. Tian Geng tried to persuade Feng Lu to stay away from Lan but in vain. Tian Geng devoted himself wholeheartedly to his work and neglected his family. Burdened with the pressure of work and family, Tian Geng had to finance 800 million yuan for the second phase of a project. Tian Geng overrode all objections and made a difficult decision to borrow the money from an international bank. Lan Yumeng was finally appointed the general director for the project and was together with Feng Lu. The project went well and Tian Geng felt that he had owed his family, colleagues and friends too much because of work.

This is a very important film to understand China’s state-owned enterprise reform in the early 1980s. The film is based on the reform of the Sichuan Panzhihua Steel Company. It was the winner of the Best Film at the 12th Hundred Flowers Film Festival in 1989. Guangxi Film Studio was established in 1958, and some of the more well-known movies produced by the film studio include the Fifth Generation’s groundbreaking film, Yellow Earth (dir. Chen Kaige, 1985) and Not One Less (dir. Zhang Yimou, 1999). The film provides insights into the challenges of China’s state-owned enterprise reform in its early stage and has a positive tone. Now three decades after Chinese leader, Deng Xiaoping launched the economic reform, Chinese society has undergone tremendous changes. Anyone interested in China’s state-owned enterprise reform may also want to watch Chinese independent filmmaker, Wang Bin’s Tie Xi Qu: West of the Tracks (2003), which presents another aspect of the state-owned enterprise reform.
The leading actor of the film, Tang Guoqiang is very well-known in China. He has appeared in many films and TV series. (4 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: The Republic of the Philippines
results.creator_credit: Leo Guelpa Jr, Dudley Pictures and United World Films
results.brief_description: Republic of the Philippines, seen through the eyes of a young Filipino teacher. The geographical background, the native races, the landscape, cultivation of various crops, the development of industries, mineral resources, forest products and hydro-electricity, and the growth of the education and public health systems.

results.title: The Republic of South Africa: the land and its people - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Clifford J. Kamen and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Compares three ways of life in the Republic of South Africa: tribal life, white farmers and mining communities. Shows how the culture patterns of each region are influenced by the topography climate, and resources of the region.

results.title: The Report
results.creator_credit: Royal North Shore Hospital of Sydney, New South Wales. Dept. of Health, Pamela Scott, Suzy Molony and Tony Wheeler
results.brief_description: A dramatised film of a day in the life of an assistant personnel manager. An annual report is overdue and as a result of his own inefficiency, the main character allows the day’s events to finally overwhelm him. Ideal discussion promoter about how to organise commitments so as to cope effectively with the demads of work and personal life. Cinematography by Tom Cowan. Written and directed by Tony Wheeler.

results.title: The Repco-Brabham story
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Cine Service Production
results.brief_description: Briefly shows manufacture and testing of racing cars by the Brabham Racing Organisation in England, followed by views of the 1965 Tasman Series motor races in Australia and New Zealand, Jack Brabham and others competing in Brabham cars. Finally, manufacture of a new Repco engine in Australia is shown.

Finally, manufacture of a new Repco engine in Australia is shown.
